Literature Review: LysR-type transcriptional regulators (LTTRs) are a diverse family of bacterial regulators that play a crucial role in various aspects of bacterial metabolism and physiology. Their versatility and complexity have made them an attractive target for biotechnological and medical applications. This review aims to provide an update on the molecular basis of regulation, the complexity of regulatory schemes, and applications in biotechnology and medicine.
